headline: Zucchini Apple Bread
description: A lightly sweet zucchini bread with walnuts and apples.
name: Zucchini Apple Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 2 - 9x5 inch loaf pans.

In a large bowl, combine eggs, white sugar, brown sugar, oil and vanilla until well blended. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Stir flour mixture into egg mixture. Fold in walnuts, zucchini and apple. Pour into prepared pans.
Bake 1 hour, or until top springs back when touched lightly in center. Let cool in pans 10 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: I used a small processor for the nuts and zucchini to make them a nice small mixture size. I also used pure sugar cane instead of granulated sugar cause I was feeling fancy lol. Came out beautiful and delicious!!!
Excellent! The batter is on the dry side until you fold in the zucchini, apple, and nuts. It came out perfect!
Quick and easy! Great way to use that extra zuchini!

The bread came out great after adding another 1/2 cup of oil, although if we just used the base recipe it likely would have been a fail. The batter was extremely dry and crumbly until we added the extra oil. It cooked well and was a fast and easy recipe. We didn’t use walnuts because my mother couldn’t eat them. It was more like a cake than bread, though. I would recommend this to anyone that wants a somewhat-healthy cake-ish-bread-ish hybrid.

This is an easy recipe and delicious! I did want to share my experience when making it though. The batter was more like a stiff dough at first. I let it sit in the fridge while I did other things (2 hours or so). That allowed all of the the zucchini to sweat enough to mix into a manageable batter. I made muffins, baking for 35 minutes. They were a hit!
I will make this recipe again for sure!
Loved it. I used my kitchenaide mixer the 2nd time I made this and the loaves were perfect. This recipe is a keeper.
I loved making this easy recipe, but I did add chocolate chips to it..It was very good and loved by family and friends
Quite an average bread. Simple and trusty. It was ok.
I grated the apple and zucchini without peeling either of them. Doubled the recipe and made 3 nice large loaves. Will make again. Going to use it for French toast in the morning, yum!

Great recipe but I wanted it a little healthier, so I cut the sugar in half..1/2 c. brown sugar and 1/2c. regular sugar. I also used half whole wheat flour and half regular flour and in place of oil, I used 1/2 c. unsweetened apple sauce with only 1 Tablespoon of oil. I also added 1tsp of baking powder. I grated both the zucchini and apple. It was a great texture, not too dense and just the right amount of sweetness.
Not sure what went wrong, but this bread came out heavy and very dry. I wasted a lot of ingredients making it too. Now I’m in search of a much better recipe.
it was good, I left out the walnuts because my mom can't eat them, I would add more spices, moist. Am going to freeze in slices for mom to eat for breakfast.
Loved

I think next time I will increase the salt and sweetness just a bit.I did not put a sugar topping over it, so that may be the issue with the sweetness. 
 Other than that the bread was very good.I brought it to my sitting group and everyone gave me wonderful complements, so Im happynthat they all enjoyed it so much.
The only thing is that it swells a lot. Not a problem! It just needs an extra (a little smaller) pan!!!
I made it as written and it was delicious!!! It’s a keeper in my house. Thank you.
Very good. I am lazy and just dump everything together in one large bowl! Also, I did not peel anything, and used 1.5 cups zucchini and 1.5 apple.
Easy recipe to make. You can always put more apples in it and less zucchini if you want. Always seems to be variations of this recipe.
I followed the recipe except reduced white sugar to 3/4 c. It was a little dry for my taste. If I make this again I will add another apple or zucchini or perhaps applesauce. Good with cream cheese.

Great recipe. I made changes for diabetic diet. Came out extremely moist and sweet. 

	• 4 eggs
	• 20 packets o of Stevia sugar
	• 1 cup brown sugar
	• 1 cup butter
	• 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
	• 1 1/2 Flax meal 
	• 2 cups flour
	• 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
	• 1/2 teaspoon salt
	• 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
	• 1 cup chopped walnuts
	• Chopped and peeled zucchini (2 medium zucchini)
	• Peeled and chopped apple ( 3 medium apples)
Dry and tasteless. Awful.

This was an easy recipe but way to dry and bland for my taste preferences the first time. The first batch, I cut the flour back by 1/2 cup, sugar back by 1/2 cup, and added 1/2 tsp of nutmeg and used zucchini I had squeezed the liquid out of. Still thick and bland. Next time I make it I will add 1 cup of applesauce or make sure you use fresh, drained but not squeezed, zucchini, and add more spice. I would also check on the bread after 30 minutes. 40 minutes was too long. This thick batter cooks quickly. 1 hour and I would've had dog treats.

I got 2 loaves out of the quantities listed in the recipe. Even after doubling the olive oil and adding apple sauce and an extra egg, I would have liked the cake to be more moist. I'm glad I added nutmeg too. I made a lemon glaze and garnished it with pecans and matcha covered chocolates. I would make this again, and since I love variety, I'd switch it up and try making it vegan with flaxmeal instead of eggs.
Amazingly easy and oh so good. Made this for not only my family but for special friends as a gift for the holidays. All raved and keep asking when I'll be making again!

I made this bread twice. The 1st time I made it I followed the recipe and directions exactly. Result: My son, his wife and both of his boys loved it (hence, the 5 Stars). Both my Husband and I are diabetic, so the 2nd time I made it, I altered it (as I alter all of my "for our consumption only" quickbread recipes) by: (a) using 3/4 All-Purpose flour + 1/4 White Wheat Flour; (b) 1/2 Canola Oil + 1/2 Applesauce; and (c) substituting Splenda for the Sugar . And it was delightful -- especially at Breakfast and especially when my "secret ingredient" (Vanilla extract) Cream Cheese spread was applied. I've been using my Vegetable Peeler to prepare my "additions" to my Breads for years (and then I cut the pieces into 3rds or quarters) and I made no exception here. This Bread freezes well. Next time, I'm going to make it into Muffins (reducing baking time to 35-40 minutes) if only because Muffins are easier to grab and run with on busy weekday mornings.

This was okay. I didn't use nuts because they're not allowed in my kids' school lunches. A good use of any zucchini or apple that you need to clear out of the fridge. I couldn't tell there was apple in the bread. I don't think I'd make this again.

I made this gluten free using almond flour, gluten free pie crust mix and a little gluten free Bisquick to make up the required amount of flour. My bread was light, fluffy, moist and super wonderful!!! I will put this on my favorites list.
Made no changes, except, did add raisins. This is a good moist bread. Did not taste shredded apple, so next time, I'll use a tart Granny Smith apple. And, there will definitely be a next time!

Batter is very thick, thought I'd have to add more liquid ~ however after I added the zucchini and apple the batter loosened up enough to finish and spoon into pans. Tasty, perfect with tea or coffee! I cut the loaves into serving size pieces and froze them to take on a camping trip. Two thumbs up!
It's good, but I think it needs more spice to it.
I would make again. Very moist, great flavor.
Except for grating the zucchini, I followed the recipe. I found these to be pretty bland and tasteless. They are more dense than fluffy.

I used grated zucchini and chopped and grated apple (honey crisp). Didn't have walnuts is I used cinnamon roasted pecans. Smelled great in the oven and tasted great. Moist and flavorful. Recipe is a keeper.

I've made this several times in the last year. I swapped out all the oil for apple sauce, and half the white flour with whole wheat flour. I also added 1/2 cup of raisins and, reduced the sugar by a third. The bread is moist and just sweet enough for the entire family. This recipe makes great muffins as well. I sprinkled course sugar on the tops before baking at 350 degrees for 20-22 minutes. It yielded 18 regular sized muffins. Delicious!

I grated both the zucchini and the apple and omitted the nuts, as I had none on hand. Very nice bread! The baking time was too long for me do next time I will check it at 50 minutes. Maybe a bit bland compared to others but I like this one very much.
It came out perfect, it was moist and delicious.

We tried this recipe and thought it came out too dense. The version of this recipe that we liked best included these modifications (based on 12 servings): 1 cup flour, 1 cup oats, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/4 cup white sugar, used un-peeled zucchini and un-peeled apples. 

Next time we make it, we will reduce the sugar to just 1/4 cup brown sugar (or possibly use honey) and add some unflavored protein powder and more walnuts. I also may try melted butter or coconut oil instead of vegetable oil. 

Anyway, great starting recipe for us. I'm writing this review so that I can remember my modifications.

I tried it once, and made a double batch soon after! I used 1/2 oil, 1/2 applesauce, and shredded the zucchini and apple with a salad shooter. I also made them into muffins. 20-23 minutes was a more manageable wait for my sugar fix. :) Thank you for the recipe!
I shredded both the apple and the zucchini and made one loaf, a dozen muffins and six mini muffins. It was good but I will probably try a different recipe next time.
Delicious recipe! The bread turned out perfect, nice and moist with a nice apple taste to it. Plus very easy to make, Thank you!!
Horribly dry! What a disappointment. Tastes like sand.

I made this recipe without the nuts and shredded the zucchini and apple. Also I cut the flour by 1/4 cup and added 1/4 cup ground flax seed. It is delicious! My family requests it often, great recipe!

For those reporting they found this bread not very moist, it could easily be because there's a lot less oil in this recipe than there is in most recipes of this type. After a gagillion years of baking experience I stuck with what I was comfortable with and doubled (yes, DOUBLED) the amount of oil. As I expected, I was quite content with the outcome. As for the zucchini, I shredded it - I know I wouldn't have cared for biting into pieces of zucchini in a sweet muffin. I omitted the walnuts so everyone would be happy, but I believe these would be equally delicious with or without them. Half the recipe was just right for 12 gorgeous, perfectly risen and rounded muffins which I topped with demerara (aka turbinado) sugar before baking. (If you choose to make this recipe as muffins, bake them at 350 degrees 20-25 minutes) These are moist and just sweet enough, the apple lending a lot of extra flavor using zucchini alone wouldn't. While I ended up loving these, for me having to double the oil to ensure a moist muffin, particularly since this is a deviation from other, similar tried and true recipes, made this a 4, rather than 5-star recipe for me.
Amazing recipe. Grate the zucchini and apple for sure. But the flavor is perfect, just the right amount of sweetness.
I made 3 smaller loaves and baked for 45 min. They were a little dry.
I used 1/4 cup of low-fat sour cream and 1/4 cup oil instead of the full 1/2 cup of oil. It turned out very well!
Moist, but don't like chunks of zucchini
Very nice. Just chop apples quite fine.
It was not as sweet as I thought it would be, but not bad. I substituted banana for apple as one reviewer suggested, but next time I will use the grated apple.

This came out dry. I halved the recipe for one loaf and it appeared too dense going in, so I should've known. I even shredded everything as others had suggested. Maybe at 45 mins I over baked it, I dunno. I do like the flavor though, so I will try again and add 1/2 c u/s applesauce and bake 5 mins less to see if that helps.

O my goodness, this was so good! the crust was crispy and sweet and the inside soft and fluffy and perfect. The recipe is great, don't need to change anything. Chop or grate the zucchini and apple, comes out good either way. One time I was out of oil and used buttermilk, it was just as good.

i just made this bread..it was too dry when i mixed it up..i used a food chopper for the apples and zucchini and when it was all put together, it was really dry..no way it would pour..so i added a can (8 oz) of crushed pineapple..and a dash of cloves and a dash of nutmeg..this is an excellent recipe and adding the pinapple only made it better..and the moisture level was much better..this is my new favorite bread recipe..gave it four stars as i think the recipe should have been moister, but with the addition of the pineapple, i will say it is a 5..i also added a handful of raisen that i had left in the fridg..very tasty
We Felt that the instructions to use chopped zucchini and apple should be shredded. The product itself was delicious. The bread was moist and filling. Great recipe.

My family loves the way I make this bread. I like to grate the zucchini and apple. I also use 3/4 of applesauce and decrease the baking soda to 1 tsp. Added 1 tsp of baking powder, 1 tsp salt, and about half a cup of white chocolate chips.

Bread is light and fluffy - not too sweet. I added an extra 1/2 cup of apples per some of the comments of the other reviewers. Also omitted the walnuts based on personal preference. Converts to gluten free really well, too (just minus a few tablespoons of flour if using rice flour). Very yummy - will make again, soon!

This is a lovely zucchini bread. The addition of chopped apples is a nice change. The texture was perfect, and it was not too sweet. For my personal preference, I would add a little more chopped apples the next time I make this.
This was a fine recipe just nothing exciting. I'll stick to other zucchini breads in the future.
tasty bread. I will definitely make this again.
Very good. I will add more apples next time.

Really great recipe, and great use for all my zucchini/summer squash and apple! I made the changes I usually make to baked recipes (ww flour, less sugar, applesauce for part of oil, twice as much spice), and my amounts of zucchini/summer squash and apple weren't exactly the same, and it held up great. Moist, slightly sweet, rich... I'm sure it's wonderful exactly as is, and I can tell you that it's fantastic to play around with too!
Extremely yummy warm or cold had to make something with zucchini for a cooking class assignment and this was perfect the entire class could not stop eating this :)

I made 4 mini loaves and 6 large muffins, I've already gone through the muffins, they turned out great. The only change I made was to decrease the white sugar to 2/3 c., that's all I had. I like the less sweet flavor and the texture is great. Baked the muffins for 20 minutes and the mini loaves for 35 minutes.

I cut this recipe in half and made muffins from the batter instead of one big loaf. I kept the vanilla extract at a teaspoon. I made no other changes. I baked the muffins at 350* for 22 minutes. This recipe turned out a very moist muffin that was slightly chewy and very flavorful. I'd make this again. I'd like to try this with half whole wheat flour and a half cup or so of organic raisins thrown in.

Great bread! I made a few healthy swaps. I used 1 1/3 cup flour and 1 cup each of whole wheat and whole wheat pasty flowers. Cut the apples into very small chunks. Also used apple sauce in place of oil as I do in all my baking recipes. Alos used all egg whites.
Fabulous! I did shred and keep the skins on both the zucc & apples.

great taste!

I doubled the amount of grated apple and it came out perfect!
This was good bread. I shredded the zucchini and apples. I thought it tasted better the next day but my son just loved it!
These are delicious and I also made them healthy for my family..added extra zucchini, extra chopped apples and a banana to these and made them into muffins..baked at 340 for 20 mins. YUM!
It's ok. I actually didn't do apple, but used apple sauce instead of oil and 1 2/3 c of 100% whole cane sugar (rapudura) instead of the two sugars.

This was delicious! I did as someone suggested & grated the apple & zucchini but otherwise followed the recipe exactly - this was FABULOUS!! We work cross-culturally & can't get alot of things t make different kinds of recipes but many people make various kinds of bread - my daughter said this is the best kind of bread she has EVER had!
This recipe was easy & turned out good. Be careful not to overcook or it is too dry. Its very good paired with fruit such as blueberries & blackberries for a light & healthy meal.

I liked the level of sweetness, sweet but not overly sweet. However, I didn't think it was "light and fluffy" like the description claimed. I do think I overmixed it a bit which added to some of the denseness, but that aside, it just wasn't that flavorful.

Absolutely fabulous!! The only thing I changed was shredding instead of chopping the zucchini and apple because I like the consistency better that way. I also added chopped walnuts to the top because I like the crunch.
awesome!
Something just seemed to be missing. I will try adding more spice next time. It did go well toasted with Dulce de Leche.

I just got finished putting this together and was a bit confused. I substituted 2 cups of the flour for whole wheat flour and when I went to mix it into the egg mixture it was so thick there was no way I could "pour" it into the loaf pans. I added more oil, another egg, and some milk before it was even close to the consistency I have seen in other recipes. Did I do something wrong? Seems like its a bit shy on the liquid ingredients to me. Anyway, I just stuck it in the oven and can't wait to try it out.

Absolutely love this bread. It is so moist and full of flavor. I used applesauce instead of the butter and was out of walnuts, so I used pecans in the bread instead. Will make over and over, especially in the upcoming fall months. Thank you!

This was a big disappointment. I made this a week or so after making Blueberry Zucchini bread which was the best, most moist z bread I've ever made, so my expectations were high. But this bread came out dry and a little bland. I don't think I did anything wrong following the directions, but it cooked in half the time and as I said it was dry. I believe the flour to oil ratio is way off. I won't bother trying to fix it though because next time I'll just use the Blueberry recipe and substitute apples for the berries.
I used a mixture of rice flour and garbanzo bean flour instead of the wheat flour (husband is allergic to wheat), didn't drain my zucchini, was delicious.

Great flavor - I headed the recommendations of others and grated both the apple and zuch, and added 1 more egg. Cooked perfectly. I used Organic Oat flour instead of all purpose - didn't seem to affect the texture - I'll definately add this to my favorites!
I love quick breads, but I thought this one was much too sweet. If I make it again I will reduce the sugar by half.

This is an excellent, fast recipe for one of those situations where you're expected to bring in a baked cook for the next day and only have a weekday night with limited time. I cut the recipe in half and shredded 1 medium zucchini and 1 medium apple. I substituted two teaspoons of baking powder for baking soda. I also used whole wheat pastry flour rather than regular flour. The bread came out quite well. I will definitely make this again.
SOoooooo good! I added 1/2 cup of raisins. Tastes more like cake!

I used whole wheat flour instead of white flour, and I grated the zucchini and apple instead of chopping them. I also added a little ground flax seed. I was surprised by the fact that the bread didn't rise at all. It stayed flat, dark, and almost too moist. Still good, but not anything that looks like the photo.
This was just okay. A little too dense for me, and it dried out within a day. I will stick with the Cranberry Zucchini Bread on this site.

I loved this bread. Not only did it taste wonderful, but it baked up just like the picture showed! When I made it the second time, I did add one more egg (because the batter is quite stiff) and used grated zucchini, as was suggested by other reviewers. I liked the apples chunkier, but I did cut them into very small pieces rather than grating them. This recipe has been added to my permanent collection for sure!

I was looking for a recipe to use up the apples we collected apple picking and this one is a winner! The bread turned out great! I kept one loaf and served the other at church and it got rave reviews. I followed the advice of other reviewers and grated the zucchini and apple and added an extra 1/2 teaspon of cinnamon. Yummy!
This was excellent.I brought it to work and everyone loved it.I did shred the apples and zucchinni.Also didn't have walnuts.But next time i'll try it with.

Great recipe. I cut the recipe in half for one bread. I grated the zucchini and chopped the apple. It's a very dense bread that has a nice sweetness to it. I left out the walnuts for my husband, but next time I'll leave them in and add some more chopped apple and maybe add some raisins.

This was SO SO delicious! I can't get enough of it! I used applesauce instead of oil (almost 2x the applesauce for oil to keep it moist), threw in an extra egg, and use a little bit more grated apple and zucchini than called for. It came out absolutely fantastic.

This is a great recipe. I used safflower oil instead of vegetable oil and raisins instead of walnuts. I also cut down on sugar to 3/4 cup of each. Came out moist and perfect. Big hit with whole family and a very fresh squirrel!
Love It!! My kids will not touch zucchini but they loved this bread. I stayed true to the recipe except added extra apple. It was quite yummy!
This was pretty good, different than my usual zucchini bread recipe. Not too sweet, delicious with a smear of apple butter!

LOVE LOVE LOVE! My husband was shocked when he saw me adding the zucchini( I tossed in walnuts too), but all I've gotten from him since are the best compliments! It's almost sweet enough to be a dessert cake, it's wonderful. Will make again and again!
Always looking for a new zucchini recipe. This one is a keeper! I've made 8 loaves since I discovered it and get rave reviews! Thanks for sharing!!
I wasn't sure what to expect..however this recipe has a great texture and taste. I followed the recipe exactly...what a great way to incorporate veggies without anyone knowing....

Great! I gave one loaf away as a gift and it was much enjoyed. I reduced the amount of sugar (used 1/2 cup white, 3/4 cup brown) and replaced 1 and 1/4 cups white flour with wheat. And as suggested by other reviewers, I grated the zucchini and apple. Plan on making again today.
It's good, but not great. In my opinion, I think it's a bit too bland.

A VERY nice dense moist zucchini bread. Chopped the zucchini very fine and the apple into small chunks. Cut the sugar in half and used all cane sugar instead. Still can taste the sweetness but wasn't overwhelming. May consider substituting some of the sugar next time with stevia and using applesauce instead of oil to cut down on the calories.
